global.title: JHipster
global.browsehappy: Sie benutzen einen veralteten Browser. Bitte aktualisieren Sie Ihren Browser, um die Benutzerfreundlichkeit zu erhöhen.

main.title: Willkommen, Java Hipster!
main.subtitle: Dies ist Ihre Hauptseite
main.callout: Dies ist eine persönliche Website. Ich bin ein Entwickler und lebt in New York City. Hier sind einige von meinen Bildern, fühlen Sie sich frei, um Sie auf zu ziehen.

logged.authenticated:
Wenn Sie sich anmelden möchten, versuchen Sie es mit
- Administrator (Name="admin" und Passwort="admin")
- Benutzer (Name="user" und Passwort="user").

main.question: Wenn Sie Fragen zu JHipster haben:

link.contact: kontaktieren Sie uns mit @java_hipster auf Twitter

main.like: Wenn Sie JHipster mögen, vergessen Sie nicht uns einen Stern zu geben auf

resume.title: Resumes
resume.summary_content: As a professional I have enjoyed working with many impressive people who I have learned from. Over the past three years I have worked with both front end and backend web technologies.

e1.title: Web Developer
e1.durration: The Lathe, March 2011 – Present (3 years 2 months) New York, NY
e1.description: Designing and updating web, mobile web and mobile apps using the following technologies: Servers (ASP.NET, PHP, Tomcat, Java, Spring Framework, NODEJS), DBs (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB), Mobile apps (iOS), web development (CSS3, HTML5, jQuery). Experience with responsive web design and fallback development for legacy (IE) browsers. Experience with UI/UX design process.

e2.title: Developer/DBA
e2.durration: Apparently, Inc March 2012 – June 2013 (1 year 4 months) New York, NY
e2.description: Developing iOS Webkit modules using Jade, Stylus, client side Javascript and server side NodeJS Javascripting. Administrating and generating reports on MongoDB.

e3.title: Web Developer
e3.durration: Villas by Linda Smith September 2010 – March 2011 (7 months)

e4.title: Helpdesk Supervisor
e4.durration: The National Academies August 2004 – March 2010 (5 years 8 months) Washington, DC
e4.description: Technolgoy support, training, reporting and management

e5.title: Internship
e5.durration: Jane Goodall Institute August 2003 – December 2003 (5 months)
e5.description: Managing the membership access database. Reporting on Raiser's Edge Oracle database. Providing customer service to program members. Developing GIS component to system.

e6.title: 10gen (the MongoDB company)
e6.description: Learned how to use MongoDB in the context of application development https://s3.amazonaws.com/edu-cert.10gen.com/downloads/e07a6da9252a4c6db970aa396b4ad71c/Certificate.pdf

e7.title: American University
e7.durration: Science Masters; Applied Sciences degree focused; Bachelors, Biotechnology 2004 – 2006

e8.title: University of Vermont
e8.description: Designing and updating web, mobile web and mobile apps using the following technologies: Servers (ASP.NET, PHP, Tomcat, Java, Spring Framework, NODEJS), DBs (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB), Mobile apps (iOS), web development (CSS3, HTML5, jQuery). Experience with responsive web design and fallback development for legacy (IE) browsers. Experience with UI/UX design process.

e9.title: Web Development
e9.description: AngularJS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Yeoman, Grunt, Bower, Foundation, Bootstrap, JQuery, CSS3
